items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Flooding is possible over the high tide on Sunday evening. High water at Teignmouth is at 20:15pm on Sunday evening, times of high water will vary along the coast. Force 4 Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 1.10m are forecast to cause minor wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required. Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Teignmouth is 2.01 mAOD on Sunday evening and 2.19 mAOD on Monday morning.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have remain high but are stabilising on the lower River Cherwell following recent heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying roads and land is possible today 20/03/22, especially in the Thrupp and Kidlington area. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message this evening 20/03/22, or as the situation changes. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings.

The risk of flooding from the River Nene has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.description: North Bank Road alongside the River Nene, east of Peterborough and west of Dog-in-a-Doublet Sluice
items.message: The River Nene has being falling steadily today, Sunday 20th March. North Bank Road will be reopened once the Highways Authority have been able to inspect the road surface and carry out any necessary works to ensure the road is passable. There may be standing water in low lying areas and fields for several days.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are stable on the River Ray following heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying roads and land is possible today 20/03/22, especially in the Islip area. The forecast is for a dry day and start to the week.   
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message this evening, 20/03/22, or as the situation changes.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings.

floodArea.county: Cambridgeshire, North Northamptonshire, Peterborough, West Northamptonshire

items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Nene has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are stable on the River Thame following heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible today (20/3/22) around Stadhampton. The forecast is for a dry day and start to the week.   
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message this evening, 20/03/22, or as the situation changes. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings.
